title: Daniela Klemenschits
text:
Daniela Klemenschits (13 November 1982 – 9 April 2008) was an <a href="Austrian%20people">Austrian</a> professional <a href="tennis%20player">tennis player</a>. She won a total of 23 <a href="Tennis%20terminology%23D">doubles</a> titles on the ITF Circuit in her career.
Early life.
Daniela and twin sister <a href="Sandra%20Klemenschits">Sandra</a> (fellow pro-player) were born in <a href="Vienna">Vienna</a>, Austria.
Tennis career.
Daniela played doubles with sister Sandra on the <a href="WTA%20Tour">WTA Tour</a> and the <a href="ITF%20Women%27s%20Circuit">ITF Women's Circuit</a>. The team dominated <a href="Tennis%20terminology">doubles tennis</a> in Austria in the mid-2000s, becoming the country's No. 1 team in 2006. She won a total of 23 titles on the ITF-level and reached one final on the WTA Tour-level. She reached the top 100 of the WTA doubles rankings in 2005. Daniela also represented Austria on the <a href="Fed%20Cup">Fed Cup</a> in 2005, where they defeated <a href="Switzerland%20Fed%20Cup%20team">Switzerland</a>.
Daniela played her final professional match on 14 December 2006, at the tournament in <a href="Valasske%20Mezirici">Valasske Mezirici</a>, Czech Republic. She had partnered sister Sandra, losing in round one against <a href="Eva%20Hrdinov%C3%A1">Eva Hrdinová</a> and <a href="Stanislava%20Hrozensk%C3%A1">Stanislava Hrozenská</a>, 5–7, 2–6.
Death.
In January 2007, both Klemenschits twins were diagnosed with a rare form of abdominal cancer, <a href="squamous%20cell%20carcinoma">squamous cell carcinoma</a>, forcing their retirement. Fellow tennis players rallied for Klemenschits and donated money to pay off the removal of several tumours and the expensive medical care required. Daniela died on 9 April 2008 in <a href="Salzburg">Salzburg</a>, aged 25. Sandra, however, survived and returned to the doubles tour in July 2008.
